moves.2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 Bg7 4. e4 d6 5. Nf3 O-O: Is 7...a5 preferable to stop the b4 push?
moves.8. b4: And there is the b4 push.
moves.8... b6 9. O-O a5: Better late than never?  Need to deal with the aggressive Queenside expansion and make some room.
moves.13. Nb5: Revealing the Queen as a second defender to the c4 pawn.
moves.13... Qd7: Adding another attacker to the b5 square.
moves.14. Rab1: Adding another defender to the b5 square.
moves.14... Rab8: Adding a revealed attacker to b5 after 15...Nxc4.
moves.15... Nxc4: Breaking open the Queenside and winning a pawn.
moves.16. Bxc4 Bxb5 17. Bxb5 Rxb5 18. Rxb5 Qxb: Attacking the Knight and skewering the Rook.
moves.20... Qe2: Attacking both the Knight and the e4 pawn.
moves.21. Rb2: Adding pressure on the second rank but leaving the back rank undefended.  I looked long and hard at a way to exploit this but came up short.  21...Qe1+ is met with 22.Nf1.
moves.21... Bxd2 22. Qxd2 Qxe4 23. Qxa5 Nxd5: Taking two pawns for one and bringing the Knight into the action.
moves.25. Bb4: If 25...Nxb4 then 26.Rxb4 takes back and attacks the Black Queen with tempo.  Instead...
moves.25... Rxa2: !!  If 26. Rxa2 then 26...Qb2+ wins it back and gains a pawn.  So instead...
moves.26. f3: I honestly did not consider this move but Black is up three pawns and exchanges are to his advantage so...
moves.27. fxe4 Rxd2 28. Bxd2 Nf4: Keeping the third pawn.  And now we enter the endgame where Black has a decisive advantage.
moves.29. Kf2 Kf8 30. g3 Ne6 31. Ke3 Ke7 32. K: Moving the Black King to support the strong central pawn push.
moves.33. h4 h5 34. Be3 c5 35. Kc4 Kc6 36. Bf2: As the King is driven away the Bishop can safely be exchanged for the Knight.  Better might be 43. Bxe3 but White would still be in the worse position.
moves.43... Nxg5 44. hxg5 Ke6: Calculated that White has no chance of making a Queen without being caught while Black can Queen without being caught and White resigned.

gameName: Pawns Really Can Make a Difference
opening: King's Indian (E93), Petrosian system, main line
